replies.body: 'cause it's possible to forget how to play Lux? She's one of the easiest mid laners.

Simple kit, not exactly "Easy" to play, though.

BUT it doesn't even matter because of his freaking windwall -_-

I'd argue against that. But to each their own, I suppose?

I've never understood that.  She isn't any easier than any other mage, besides maybe Orianna or Vel'Koz.  Her abilities are just simple and to the point and not overloaded with a ton of extra bullshit.  She's easier to understand, but not really easier to play.
Lux actually tends to throw people off when learning her because she's one of the few mages that are supposed to weave autos into their combos.

I watched a Rengar jump from stealth onto him, my dad pressed Q then pressed R and the Rengar was 20% hp remaining.

Went against 5 elementalist Lux's in OFA as panth. Early game was pretty unfun but once we got Edge/banshees or any mr it was so one sided, once Lux uses her q and misses vs an assassin she's pretty boned with 0 mobility, pretty sure if the rengars assumably went full ad against lux they would have lost unless ahead

That is a common missunderstanding. Skillshot mages have an easy kit, but have a harder playstyle, not only because you have to hit skillshots, but you have to rely heavily on proper positioning in teamfights and in lane to be successful
Yeah, but there's a difference between remembering, say, her combos, and remembering how to play her effectively by zoning and such.
That's true.  When I learned how to play Lux, I always built mejais as a motivator to not die lol.  Because of that, she's the champion I have the lowest average deaths on by far.
